intro: Micromeria gontscharovii, commonly known as the Gontscharov's micromeria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of tiny, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
